channel.title: Blog on ENDARI
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on ENDARI

item.title: Problems of a Perfectionist
item.description: Chapter One The trap of perfection After over 30 years of walking the earth believing the problem was with everything else but me, I just recently found out most of the goal I never achieved were the direct result of a very big lie I’ve bin telling myself all my life, “Perfection is the goal!”. Looking back now, I even have a list of rules, that the first command of which reads like this: “Do it, only if you can do it perfectly”, and oh boy!

item.title: All About Markdown üóíÔ∏è
item.description: Markdown A simple text file that looks good! We can kind of call it the html of plain text. A title in markdown is simply shown by a single-pound sign followed by a single or multiple spaces -> # , and as you add to the number of pound-signs (like ## or ###), you decrease the size of the title. # this would be <h1> title ## and this would be <h2> title .

item.title: My First Post
item.description: Testing Let’s begin by a subtitle! And some more subheading text This is a paragraph of text, with important and semi important words. do I need to wrap my text with enters, or it will be aligned as justified? who knows! now lets write some lists and code blocks and quotes: Some list Things to do: read the documentation. find a good subject to write about write the blog polish and publish And now some code: def averager(*args: int) -> float: return sum(args) / len(args) A picture: Emoji Test :grinning_face:üôÇ :winking_face_with_tongue: ::grinning_face::üôÇ

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.
